author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Thailand launches zoo guidebook to promote adventure tourismTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Thailand launches zoo guidebook to promote adventure tourism Published on : Wednesday, September 2, 2015
In order to promote adventure tourism and attract more visitors to the seven zoos in Thailand, Zoological Park Organisation of Thailand (ZPO) has launched a zoo guidebook, Thai News Agency (TNA) reported.
The pocket book “Amazing Zoo” launched by ZPO, features information of animal at the seven zoos namely Dusit Zoo in Bangkok, Khao Kheow Open Zoo in eastern Chon Buri Province, Ubon Ratchathani, Khon Kaen, Nakhon Ratchasima zoos and Surin Elephant Kingdom Project in the Northeast and Songkhla Zoo in the South.
The ZPO plans to develop and transform Thailand’s zoos into the environment oriented “Green Zoos”, so that it could become a zoo and safari adventures hub.
Thailand was one of the two ASEAN member countries granted certification by the World Association of Zoos and Aquariums (WAZA), revealed Benjapol Nakprasert, Director of ZPO under the Royal Patronage of the King, More than five million tourists visited zoos in Thailand last year, he said.
